Question: filtering algorithm trouble: :public static String filterPhoneNumber(String phoneNumber) {    Character[] characters = new Character[phoneNumber.length()];    if (characters.length > 9)    {        for (int i = 0; i < characters.length; i++)        {            if (characters[i] != ' ')            {                characters[i] = phoneNumber.charAt(i);            } else            {                Log.d("asd", "wrroooonggggggggg");            }        }    }    return phoneNumber;}Im trying to filter empty chars in the number, but when 2 or more empty chars are found in the string, it removes only the first. 
Please using this api: String.getBytes.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: String.getBytes
<<<code>>>: 
try { byte[] b = string.getBytes(Charset.forName("UTF-8")); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
<<<explanation>>>: This code will convert the given String to a byte array using the UTF-8 character set. The problem with the given filtering algorithm is that it is not handling the case where two or more consecutive empty characters are present in the string. To fix this, you can modify the algorithm to check for consecutive empty characters and remove them from the string.
